Sequence Information.Peptide Name: Eotaxin-2 (CCL24, CCL-24, cytokine, CC family; kinocidins; UCSS1a; 2S=S, natural AMPs; human,  primates, mammals, animals; variants)

Literature Information.Literature: Eotaxin-2 induced chemotaxis of eosinophils as well as basophils via the CCR3 receptor.Activity: Active against the airway pathogens S. pneumoniae, S. aureus, Non-typeable H. influenzae, and P. aeruginosa (see the 2014 ref). The primary structure was reported in 1997 byForssmann U and colleagues. Three C-terminal truncated variants with 73, 75, and 76 residues were isolated as well. NMR structure (73 residues) was solved in 2000 (go to the PDB link).You can rotate, zoom, and view the 3D structureherein the PDB.  Reg 12/10/2014.
Literature Information.Author: Gela A, Kasetty G, Jovic S, Ekoff M, Nilsson G, Mörgelin M, Kjellström S, Pease JE, Schmidtchen A, Egesten A.2014
Literature Information.Title: Eotaxin-3 (CCL26) exerts innate host defense activities that are modulated by mast cell proteases.
